comments.body: System zee made this idea, you are copying him.
Nice idea! That would be a great addition to combat. I could see it being really fun, and hilarious!
Guys, I think that these items will be so fun in Minecraft servers. They can be useful in Minecraft farms wich uses mobs.
genius

Or even use them in making potions of poison...
Or maybe (since they’re not too common) they could cause a huge rise in a composter...
I think it should be used in making the nausea potion
Slimeballs, nausea splash potions and maybe even poison potions

Alternate uses:

- "Planting" a Poisonous Potato could yield a Moss block.

- Using Poisonous Potato as a substitute recipe ingredient for poison potions, interchangeable with Spider Eye.

- A poisonous suspicious stew if fed to a mooshroom like the flowers.

 

if nothing else, at least please make it compostible.
Have you ever opened a door made of stone?
It’s the little things that make Minecraft so much better
This is Minecraft not real life, I mean you can literally go to the depths of hell.
I am surprised we don't have them
Doors and trapdoors sound great, gates don't seem very logical though, seeing as there's no stone fence.

Stone doors and trapdoors make sense for fantasy builds like dwarven mines. A stone gate for the the stone walls would be very nice, but perhaps a different design than the wooden ones, either something heavy, or something with lots of holes.
I would also like to see Jeeps, tents, boats, cars, trucks, ATV's, kayaks, campfires, campers, and other camping mods.
Another addition to this could be backpacks as well.

Perhaps it could use ice as a Nether version of cobblestone generation, as it is Nether cobblestone.  Of course, it might get a little annoying having to carry ice back and forth to get some blackstone.
cobble stone + basalt = black stone
Maybe Cartographer villagers would also be able to give the map from a rare trade

I do really like the idea of piglins giving you the direction to a bastion in exchange for gold. maybe you could balance it by making it so if you get more than one map in the same area from trading it'll keep giving you the same map. I really like this idea as i think piglin trades aren't very great right now. It's very balanced for end game farms, and this is great because it won't help farms. Also i don't like the idea of villagers being able to trade you the maps. First of all how would they even know where to find them? Secondly it would take away from the piglin's trading abilaity if this was added, making it less interesting in my opinion. And lastly that would totally be abused.

This is a cool idea!  Here, I made a map for it:

(It has burn marks in it.  What do you think?)

And here's what it could look like on the map:

This could also be a Cartographer Trade that is only obtainable if the trade is unlocked in the nether. (which is how it would work in my suggestion for a Nether Fortress explorer map.)
one more thing this feature is even more vital because of the 1.20 update causing you to need netherite upgrades.
Pistons are mined faster by picks. Other than that, vote!
just not beacons and cakes they are supposed to be infuriating as hell

Creative mod:
I'm a joke for you?
otplusot we are talking about survival keep it relevant
I support that. Even if hoppers would only have 1 filter slot where you'd have to place an item as a template that would be extreemly strong addition!
I think it can be done with Redstone but I agree, a more straightforward means of deciding what a hopper processes and how it does it would be nice.

Comparto la idea de Tolvas selectivas con una nueva interfaz donde una barra de bloqueo permita regular el paso del item o items que se coloquen en sus ranuras. Una vez activada la barra de bloqueo, los items a la izquierda del selector de la barra de bloqueo pasarian en la dirección que apunta la tolva y los items colocados a la derecha pasarian a una tolva que se encuentre debajo. De esta forma se podría apartar de la línea de transporte un solo item o varios que estén relacionados e interese tenerlos cerca sin necesidad de crear otras líneas de tolvas para transportarlos.
[I share the idea of ​​selective hoppers with a new interface where a blocking bar allows to regulate the passage of the item or items that are placed in their slots. Once the lock bar is activated, items to the left of the lock bar selector will move in the direction the hopper is pointing and items placed on the right will move to a hopper below. In this way, a single item or several related items could be removed from the transport line and it is interesting to have them nearby without having to create other lines of hoppers to transport them.] - translated by admin

RobertoFiddler, I came here to post that exact idea. Just add one "filter" slot to the current hopper's interface. Place an item in the slot, and the hopper can automatically filter by item name, and it will act as if it were full of the item in the item filter slot. This would also make it possible to reliably filter non-stackable items, and all without creating a new block, but simply revising an existing one's interface.

I don't think that makes sense within the canon. There's no such thing as microcontrollers. From a gameplay standpoint, I think it would make the late-game much less rewarding. I also think it would make the late game a lot less rewarding. Storage systems are some of the coolest, most useful redstone builds in the game, this would basically wipe all of that away. I wouldn't mind a way to simplify redstone multi-item sorters, but not this.

I was also coming on to suggest the same thing.  Filtered Hoppers.  Perhaps crafted with a Hopper and Cobweb.  Additionally, eliminate the function of picking up drops from the ground.  Now you can create item sorters without redstone circuits and without generating as much lag on servers.
This Is A Mod So They Aren’t Gonna Add It
How about double speed or some extra fuctions like it can detect entities with a block above (so farms can use regularblocks and you dont have to do minecart hopper tricks)
I want it

This would finally give a use to the masses of gold one can acquire in Minecraft. The same would be possible with copper. How to do that? Either add a slot or give one a special meaning so that the hopper will only take up items that match the one in that special slot. This way sorting even unstackable items would be covered. How to handle NBT-data would need to be sorted out by the developers (pun intended) but I suggest not to take this into account at all.
I agree. Or at the very least, when snow is falling, snow tiles shouldn't form on top of Magma Blocks.
I love this idea.
I wouldn't be surprised If Mojang decides to put this very comment on the official website to introduce the item to the game.
As a (small) balance I would make it so this collar can not be colored. Also, when filled the color should have a gold medal hanging from it, and when unfilled it should just be a collar.
This could just be crying obsidian that is used on your pet instead of dye. Alternatively, Respawn Anchors could be usable by pets

The real-life Forget-me-not flowers could be the new cyan flower since all but one flower in Minecraft are based on real flowers.

I personally forgot all about the cyan flowers! This is a great idea, but having it be a re-color of the the rose/poppy would be less interesting. So, I support PKMNmstrcass’s suggestion (see their comment from May 6th) of making it a forget-me-not flower.

@PKMNmstrcass this isn't necessarily true since wither roses and spore Blossoms are not real flowers and blue roses are sold in stores all the time even if they aren't natural. Besides minecraft shouldn't be shackled to reality so we should have fun with the plants.
Don't forget chiseled red and blue nether brick!
I like the idea, but I think it should be added to the PS4 also!
Cool but I think it needs a use besides aesthetics.
it could have some Redstone uses hmmmmmmmmmm

Its kinda interesting, but if its only purpose is building then its kinda useless, as i can only see a couple niche uses for building, and that's not good, so some alternative use would be nice (like maybe halving the redstone power that goes through it?)

It appears there is either already an existing thread on this topic (or something very similar), it's a list of items/mobs/ideas, contains a previously rejected idea, is a bug or support issue, exists, or it is too general and is being removed by our team.  Please check out this link (https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/articles/360004442111-Creating-Great-Ideas), be sure to use search, and join existing threads in progress (we read ALL the comments). Thanks!
We need better golden tools at least at nether
I really like this idea especially since the Nether update is coming soon.
This is what I was thinking about! And the chests should also have a different texture, a nether chest.
I believe the chests Piglins will "claim", are the ones that naturally generate with them, so I don't see this being a problem.

They could also have Piglin exclusive items. I see them as having a red fabric over the top, then overlaid with a thinner layer of hoglin skin with a nose and tusks where the clasp is. The main color of the chest could be goldish or a blaze-pattern look.

Maybe a fancy nether-y gold treasure chest. That should be an easy way to both show the contents are valuable AND that the contents are owned. Thus the player had plenty of warning for the consequences.
Cool idea! However I’m pretty sure that it was their intention have the piglins get mad at having any chest being opened near them.
translated to wolf armor

Hi I totally agree

I was going to post an original idea, but found this, so I thought I would chime in

But effectively my idea was for a hammer/ chisel set as a new tool type - When used on a block, it would seperate the bounding box as it were of the block, from 1 block, to say a 4x4 or hopefully a 8x8 or even 16x16 face

 



So when you click on a block, it will split it into smaller blocks within its own bounds, if it was only a 2x2 face, removing one corner would result in you getting a stair block - if you mine the block however, you would get the original block back

Example - You place a stone full block, and chisel out one corner to make a stair, then you mine the stair (without silk touch) - you recieve a cobblestone full block (wtith silk touch you get a full stone block - you DO NOT get a stair block)

The amount of faces would be set by the game coding, you wouldnt be able to chisel a 2x2 block down to just 1 corner, then chisel again to break that tiny square into a further 2x2 face

This would offer an incredible level of detail at the standard block size not seen in minecraft before even custom trees end up being 2-3 times bigger than spawnable ones, it would allow for minor changes to a blocks shape and allow players to create such things as vertical slabs

It doesnt require a massive overhaul of the games physics/ coding - the game could still see a chiselled block as a full block regardless of how much was chiseled away (it could look like stairs, but not function as them)

What if stones could be chiseled like banners but the player would need to press the block and they have 2 options decorate and chisel decorate will allow the player to chisel the block like banners and new patterns like a soul, creeper, and wither pattern. Chisel will allow the player to do what Rex Masters is suggesting.

I agree because then I can finally make a dog house. And a bird cage and if I’m replaying as a baby I can finally have a proper playpen popper baby cage and I can make food bowls for my pets and dog beds for my dogs and cat beds

I also think this would be a great addition. However I think it should only fully work with solid blocks where they are more likely to stay intact. A fun challenge to being a sculptor would be to connect all the blocks so it doesn't crumble (drop the block). To make it more "Minecraft-y" the chisel could remove on a 1/8th scale instead of 1/16th.
I feel the same with my builds if a feature like chisels and bits/little tiles was added it would make building in Minecraft so much easier

Or trebuchets.

Adding to your idea, what about ballistas and hwachas?

Ballistas: Spawn naturally in pillager outposts, or can be crafted with a crossbow in the middle, iron ingots to the sides and a base of wood planks. To use, you place it down, and it is loaded with an arrow. after a 4 sec. reload it can be fired. Dismounting the ballista returns the arrow if it had not been fired. An average hit would do 15 damage but it can vary. However, effect of armor is halved. The ballista would mainly be useful as a defensive weapon due to it's lack of mobility.

Hwachas: Used by pillagers in raids, the Hwacha is an extremely inaccurate siege weapon. It can be crafted with a dispenser in the middle, an iron block to the right and wood planks on the bottom. It would be loaded with up to 32 arrows and an equal amount of gunpowder, and fired by right clicking it with a flint and steel/ fire charge. It can be placed on the ground and faces away from the player on placement.  In raids, a single Hwacha will spawn on top of a Ravager, escorted by 2 pillagers and a vindicator. if a player does not attack them the vindicator will load the hwacha and fire it once. The hwacha is then dissembled (removed from the ravager) and the group would join the attack. The Hwacha on firing, launches the loaded arrows up to 2 chunks away. When the arrows land, they start fires and do damage (7-9). However, the arrows are very inaccurate (varying up to 60 degrees).

An amazing idea, not too overpowered since it's manual reload, another idea, not only can you put in boulders, but also multiple blocks for a shotgun style effect, and probably some rudimentary sight, nothing special and nothing too detailed or accurate, but with like a 5 block deviation in the sights, could be 5 to the left or right, and changes each time you use it, would make it just a little less OP, so you are able to aim, without being able to immediately kill players every time.
TNT Catapult

A practical, fun idea. It should probably work like an entity (like a boat) so the player can move it around/lead it. It would also be fun if the player themselves can be launched from the catapult. Maybe another input could prompt a UI to input certain blocks & ingredients for additional effects.
Love this. At first I thought it might be to mod-like for Mojang but when you compared it to an armor stand I had a different perspective. Voted.
I think this is a really cool idea that can have a lot of potential for house designs, and could be used in a lot of different ways
